newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Death toll reaches 24 in S.African mine clashes.
newsitem.headline: Death toll reaches 24 in S.African mine clashes.

text.p: Three South African miners were killed overnight in renewed ethnic clashes at a gold mine southwest of Johannesburg, taking the death toll since the weekend to 24, police said on Thursday.
They said another three people had been injured in the fighting between Xhosa and Sotho workers at a mine hostel, one of them critically.
The fighting has centred on Buffelsfontein Gold Mining Company Ltd, near Klerksdorp 160 km (100 miles) southwest of Johannesburg, which is owned by Randgold & Exploration Co Ltd.
Randgold said on Wednesday output had not been affected.
Earlier this week police raided hostels at the mine and seized explosives and home-made spears and axes.
The violence erupted last Sunday when one of the groups used explosives employed in underground blasting against the homes of rivals, killing at least seven people.
The reasons for the violence were unclear but more than 50 miners have been killed since July in ethnic fighting. President Nelson Mandela has appointed a judge to probe the causes.
